alert.note: Alert for Lavaca (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 13 at 9:14PM CDT until May 14 at 7:51PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... Middle Yegua Creek near Dime Box affecting Burleson and Lee Counties. Navidad River at Sublime affecting Lavaca County. Navidad River near Speaks affecting Lavaca and Jackson Counties. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... Navidad River at Strane Park affecting Jackson County. Navidad River at Morales affecting Lavaca and Jackson Counties. Lavaca River near Edna affecting Jackson County. For the Middle Yegua Creek...including Dime Box...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Navidad River...including Sublime, Speaks, Morales, Strane Park...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Lavaca River...including Komensky, Breslau, Hallettsville, Edna...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Navidad River at Sublime. * WHEN...Until tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 26.0 feet, Major lowland flooding begins as two channels under the Highway 90A bridge merges becoming one channel several hundred yards wide. The lowest homes in the floodplain downstream near Vienna and in Jackson County are threatened. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 25.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 PM CDT Saturday was 25.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 25.7 feet late this evening. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 24.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 25.7 feet on 03/10/2015. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sun Mon Tue Navidad River Sublime 24.0 25.3 Sat 8 pm CDT 23.2 17.0 12.6 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Sunday morning at 915 AM CDT.
